Kelly

Which way do you think is the "right" way to spell color? Honor? Favorite? As you can see, I prefer to just use "o" instead of "ou." Is this an American thing, or do other Americans spell it with "ou?" My boyfriend, who is Canadian, uses "ou." So, which do you prefer? Is one right?
Robbie

ou is right! The Canadian spelling is ou, and Canadians are, on average, 2 or 3 IQ points above Americans. (its true!)
 
 Actually a lot of Canadians use the American spelling. They try to teach us to use ou in school. :) I just use whatever I like for each word.

It is called 'English' isn't it...
 Its the 's's to 'z's (zeds, and you know it;)) that irritate me, especially in science words (any idea how annoying the spell checker is when writing essays at Uni, turn it off and my essays become giberish, turn it one and I can almsot play tunes teh nimber of times it beeps to tell me I have 'misspelt' a word, oh and its Sulphur while we are at it).
 Really does come down to accent, I do actually pronounce it colour and favourite.
 ;)
 
 Still, give me 'American English' over 133+ or txt anyday.
